A test certificate is to be submitted by a certifying plumber or an independent qualified person (IQP) for all testable devices. An “as-built” plan showing the location and type of device must accompany the certificate

The electrician is required to submit an energy works certificate certifying that all electrical installations meet the requirements of Clause G9 (Electricity) of the New Zealand Building Code and the Electrical Regulations
Producer Statement Construction Review (PS4) Drain Bridging

Producer statement construction review (PS4) is to be submitted by the engineer for the observation of the drain bridging confirming that the work complies with the design approved by this building consent and is in accordance with any relevant New Zealand Building Code clauses
(Delete if N/A) Note: CCTV video is required post slab construction
Producer Statement Construction Review (PS4) Engineers observation

Producer statement construction review (PS4) is to be submitted by the engineer for the observation of concrete foundation,sed beams confirming that the work complies with the design approved by this building consent and is in accordance with any relevant New Zealand Building Code clauses
Producer Statement Construction (PS3) Fire Stopping of Fire Rated Walls, Floors & Ceilings
Producer statement construction (PS3) is to be submitted by the installer of any passive fire protection systems (e.g. fire stopping of penetrations and intersections or joints) confirming that:-
• An inspection of each system has been carried out by the installer; and
• Where there are variations to the fire protection system that the variations have been approved by Council and certified in writing by an accredited fire protection specialist; and
• Evidence that the system has been installed in accordance with the manufacturer’s installation instructions
The producer statement must be accompanied by a schedule that includes the following information:
• Name, address and contact phone number of the installer / company
• Description of service penetration or control joint
• Identification of the position of the installation (marked up plans)
• A unique number for each fire protection measure installed
Note : Each service penetration or control joint should be clearly labelled and marked; refer AS4072.1:2005 for further information

Producer statement construction review (PS4) is to be submitted by the geotechnical engineer for the observation and construction of the building platform, including site excavations, the installation of any sub-soil drainage and placement of compacted fill as necessary to form the building platform. Confirmation is also required that the work complies with the design approved by this building consent and meets the requirements and/or recommendations of the geotechnical report submitted at building consent application stage.
Producer Statement Construction (PS3) – Proprietary Product Installation

Producer statement construction (PS3) is to be submitted by the installer confirming the installation of the proprietary product is in accordance with the manufacturers’ specification and any relevant New Zealand Building Code clauses
Producer Statement Construction Review (PS4) Raft Slab

Producer statement construction review (PS4) is to be submitted by the engineer for the observation of the construction of the raft slab confirming that the work complies with the design approved by this building consent and any relevant New Zealand Building Code clauses

A producer statement construction (PS3) is to be submitted by the waterproofing membrane applicator for each membrane application, e.g. roofs, decks, tanking and wet areas confirming that construction meets the requirement of this approved building consent and any relevant New Zealand Building Code clauses
The truss manufacturer must submit a producer statement design (PS1) confirming that the trusses have been designed in accordance with the design statement and truss layout
Note: Trusses must be identifiable by label or markings fitted during manufacture

A warranty certificate from the waterproof membrane supplier or manufacturer for roofs, decks tanking and wet areas membranes is required confirming that the work complies with the design as approved in this building consent and any relevant New Zealand Building Code clauses
Code Compliance Certificate lodgement form completed/received and attached
Attach confirmation of CCC lodgement and PASS above checkpoint when CCC has been applied for
RFI'S - Reply (Attach document of replys to those RFI'S)
Attach approved Code Compliance Certificate and PASS above checkpoint when CCC has been approved
Internal-Check the internal of module to ensure the floor, cabinet, Kitchens, Vanity, Wardrobes, Linen furnitures,All Internal Area of Exposed Walls and doors are clean and no residual dust
Internal-Check the sliding door to ensure the door is closed and locked, Door runners are Vaccumed.
Internal-Check all interior doors, Fruniture Doors and main door are in closed condition & secured & cannot swing open during Transporatation
Internal-Check all loose pack items are lashed inside modules securely to avoid any movement
Internal-Visual Check the Installation of Temporaray Exposed Walls
Internal-Confirm Domestic Pesticide is sprayed Inside the Module ( Wardrobe, Kitchen Cabinets, Vanity Cabinet, Cavities, Drain Holes)
External-Check underneath & Roof of Module is cleaned with compressed air and make sure no Dust
External-Check corner blocks make sure are clean with air compressor
External-Confirm Approved Pesticide is sprayed underside of the Module
External-Visual checks to ensure there is no obvious damage on wrapping of module
External-Check that all exterior surfaces of wrapping is clean
External-Check the fastening straps around modules are tight
External-Check Polystyrene protection for all items required protection against damage ( Windows/Sliding Doors)
External-Ensure Riser and Stair case openings are clean and fixed with temporary walls/floors/ceiling
External-Ensure Hazard Markings and labelling of Access Openings are fixed
External-Final check of shrink wrapping for the touch-up welding
External-Ensure Module identification Number is Available
